translation: Before I start, let's take a look at Steve Jobs!
transcript: 在开场之前，呃我们先看一下Jobs啊！

translation: I suppose everyone has heard of Steve Jobs’ famous speech at Stanford in 2005.
transcript: 我想Jobs在零五年的那场在斯坦福的那个著名的演讲，各位应该都听过啊。

translation: Do you remember his last sentence?
transcript: 呃还记得他最后那一句话吗？

translation: Anyone?
transcript: 有人记得吗？

translation: I'll give this book as the prize.
transcript: 我把这本儿书送给他。

translation: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
transcript: Stay hungry啊stay foolish啊。

translation: You all know it.
transcript: 都知道了啊。

translation: But what I want to say is that there was a very important point in his speech which is ignored by most people.
transcript: 但是我要告诉各位的是，Jobs其实在那个演讲里有一个非常重要的观点，其实大多数人都忽略了。

translation: That point was, “remember that you are going to die.”
transcript: 就是Jobs这一句话知道吗，就说“记住你即将死去”。

translation: This was the most important proverb that guided Jobs forward.
transcript: 呃这句话是指引乔布斯啊前进的最重要的一句箴言。

translation: He even considered it as one of the most important tools when making major decisions.
transcript: 啊甚至他会认为这句话是决定他的重大决策的一个最最重要的一个工具。

translation: I remember that he read a quote when he was 17: “If you live each day as if it were your last, someday you’ll most certainly be right.”
transcript: 当时的演讲里面说了这样一句话，就十七岁的时候他读到的一句格言，呃就是“如果你把生命中的每一天都当作最后一天来过的话，那么也许你会有一天会发现你是对的。”

translation: Since then, he would look in the mirror every morning and ask himself, “If today were the last day of my life...” and so on, and so on.
transcript: 那么所以从十七岁开始啊，Jobs每天早上起来对着镜子啊，他就会说，啊这个，如果今天是生命中的最后一天，布拉布拉布拉布拉布拉啊，反正就这样啊。

translation: So does everyone understand now?
transcript: 那么然后呢，所以，各位明白吗？

translation: Do you know how he died?
transcript: 知道Jobs是怎么死的吗？

translation: He was scared of death.
transcript: Jobs是被死亡吓死的。

translation: From 17 to 56, he feared death every day for thirty-nine years, because he always thought that he was going to die.
transcript: 他从十七岁开始一直到五十六岁，三十九年间他每一天都在遭受死亡的折磨，因为他老是想着自己要死，明白吗？

translation: So do you get it now?
transcript: 所以，明白吗？

translation: Death is the most important thing for human beings.
transcript: 死亡这件事对人类来说是最重要的。

translation: So what if humans didn't die?
transcript: 那如果人类不死呢？

translation: If humans didn't die, then a general manager and a prime minister become the same thing.
transcript: 人类如果不死的话你会发现，总经理和总理其实一个道理，知道吗？

translation: What am I going to say today?
transcript: 今天我要说的是什么？

translation: In fact, I personally think that after 30 years, when we get to 2046, you will actually find out that death is not a law of nature.
transcript: 其实我个人觉得哈，那么再经过三十年以后啊，当人类进入到2046的时候，其实你会发现死亡是什么，死亡并非是一种规律。

translation: Death is exactly the same as catching a cold.
transcript: 昂死亡和感冒其实是一样。

translation: It's a disease.
transcript: 它是一种疾病。

translation: The thing that matters is how we fight it.
transcript: 啊其实就看我们如何对抗它。

translation: The evolutionary history of humans from 4.5 million years ago to the present is definitely not just an evolution in height, it’s also been an evolution of life.
transcript: 所以我想人类从450万年以前到现在的一个进化史，呃绝对不仅仅只是一个身高的进化，啊你会发现也是一个寿命的进化。

translation: What happens when this law of nature is subdued by future technology?
transcript: 所以我想当这个规律，被未来的科技征服的时候，它会怎么样？

translation: We humans do not have to die.
transcript: 其实我们人类就不必死了。

translation: There are a lot of problems that plague humans, and they can be solved easily.
transcript: 那么其实有很多困扰人类的问题，其实就迎刃而解了。

translation: How can human beings live forever?
transcript: 那么人类因何会永生呢？

translation: What I am going to say is a little bit superficial, so I have chosen some fragments to share.
transcript: 那我想这个其实今天我要讲的，呃当然这个非常地肤浅啊，只能讲一点点碎片化的东西。

translation: There are six technologies which will keep our semiconducting bodies alive forever.
transcript: 我想这六大技术，啊会从一个维度，这个维度就是保持我们的肉身，保持我们的半导体的这样的一个人体生物的体，能够持续地永续地生存下去。

translation: Let’s talk about 3D printing first.
transcript: 那么首先看看3d打印。

translation: Your ear doesn't work well?
transcript: 耳朵不好吗？

translation: Change it.
transcript: 耳朵不好，换一个，ok。

translation: If your eye doesn’t work well, take it out and switch it for a new one.
transcript: 眼珠不好，摘了换一个。

translation: This is no longer science fiction.
transcript: 我想这已经不是科幻了。

translation: This is a reality that is starting to happen.
transcript: 这是正在发生的现实。

translation: If your brain lacks a certain component, you can actually use this repair technique.
transcript: 啊我想你的大脑如果缺一块的话，其实也是可以通过这种修复的技术。

translation: This is not a problem.
transcript: 啊这是没有问题的。

translation: This is the most important part of a man, the kidney.
transcript: 这是男人最重要的部位，啊，肾脏啊。

translation: This is the most important part of a bad guy, the heart.
transcript: 啊这是坏人最重要的部位，啊，心脏啊。

translation: Any organ that you can imagine can be made by today's biological 3D printers.
transcript: 我想等等等等其实你可以想象的人类的任何一个器官，啊通过今天的生物的3D打印机都是可以实现。

translation: This is not science fiction, this is what is happening now.
transcript: 这并不是科幻，这是现在已经正在发生的事情。

translation: 3D printing can print out organs piece by piece, which you might find to be a very strenuous process.
transcript: 同样是器官，你会发现3D打印它会零零碎碎地打印出各个部位，呃其实你会觉得这非常的啊非常的费劲。

translation: So let’s take a look at a simpler thing, cloning.
transcript: 呃那么我们看看更简单的事情啊，那就是克隆啊。

translation: This is the first cloned sheep in human history.
transcript: 那我想这个是人类历史上第一只克隆羊。

translation: Everyone knows that it is Dolly.
transcript: 啊那么大家都知道叫多莉。

translation: It was cloned from a female sheep.
transcript: 啊， 那我想多莉啊是从一头母羊身上克隆过来的。

translation: So you can picture the future.
transcript: 所以你们想想看未来。

translation: If we ignore human ethics, every human being can have its own clone.
transcript: 假如我们撇开人类的伦理的话，我们人类每一个人，啊都会有一个自己的克隆体。

translation: What will that be like?
transcript: 它会怎么样？

translation: Ladies and gentlemen, that means when your nose has a problem, you can take a nose from your clone; when your ear has a problem, you can take an ear from it, too, right?
transcript: 各位，那么意味着当你的鼻子出了问题的时候，你就从你的克隆体上取你的鼻子；当你的耳朵出问题了，就从你的克隆体上取你的耳朵，是吧？

translation: The younger you are, the more valuable your cloned body will be to you.
transcript: 那么你想想看，你越年轻的时候克隆的体对你来说就越有价值。

translation: Everyone here, take advantage of this while you're young, okay?
transcript: 在座的各位，趁你们年轻，明白吗？

translation: Don't wait until you are sixty or seventy years old to clone yourself.
transcript: 趁你们还年轻的时候，不要等到六十岁七十岁再去克隆自己。

translation: It would be very uneconomical at that time.
transcript: 那个时候会非常不划算的，啊。

translation: This is already happening, and we are not talking about human ethics.
transcript: 所以我想这已经是正在发生的事情，啊我们撇开人类的伦理学。

translation: What we said just now is the concept of organs, which goes from the outside to the inside.
transcript: 那么刚才我们说的是器官的概念，是由外向内的。

translation: So now let's talk about things from the inside out.
transcript: 那么现在我们讲讲由内向外的东西。

translation: Nanotechnology is now very well developed.
transcript: 呃我想纳米技术现在已经非常的发达啊。

translation: In fact, nanotechnology is now playing a big role for our human body.
transcript: 那么其实纳米技术现在对我们的人体也起到很大的作用。

translation: You know, Richard Feynman is a very famous physicist in American history and also won the Nobel Prize.
transcript: 呃这位你们认识啊，我想Richard Feynman是美国历史上呃一个非常著名的物理学家，也曾经获得过诺贝尔奖啊。

translation: Richard Feynman was one of the best question-asking physicists in American history.
transcript: 呃那么Richard Feynman是美国历史上最会问问题的一个物理学家。

translation: His famous motto is, "A question without an answer is not the most painful thing in the world, rather, an answer without a question is.”
transcript: 呃他的名言是什么，他的名言是“这个世界上最痛苦的事情啊，不是呃有问题没有答案，而是有答案没有问题”。

translation: He was fond of asking questions.
transcript: 所以他最喜欢提问题。

translation: Once he was sick and needed surgery.
transcript: 那么他他有一次生病了，生病了需要动手术。

translation: Before he was anesthetized, he was lying on the operating table and asked the doctor a question.
transcript: 所以当他在被麻醉之前，呃当他台躺在这个手术台上的时候，他对医生问了一个问题 。

translation: He said, "Doctor, why are you standing here with a scalpel to cut my stomach and operate on me instead of turning into a peanut and doing the surgery from the inside?”
transcript: 他说：“大夫，为什么是你站在这儿拿着手术刀给我把肚子拉开给我做手术，而不是你变成一颗花生米从我这儿钻进去在我肚子里做手术？”

translation: The doctor said, “It's better if you are anesthetized.”
transcript: 大夫说：“你还是麻醉了比较好，啊。”

translation: This thing may have been considered a joke a few decades ago.
transcript: 所以我想其实这件事情在几十年前可能认为是一个笑话。

translation: But today, it is no longer a joke.
transcript: 但今天各位，这不是一个笑话啊。

translation: Now our nanotechnology has reached the point where we can pack two thousand such nanoparticles in one red blood cell.
transcript: 今天我们的纳米技术我们已经到了这样的程度啊，在一个红细胞内呃就可以容纳两千个这样的纳米的颗粒。

translation: What can such nanoparticles do?
transcript: 那么这样的纳米颗粒可以做什么？

translation: They can circulate in your blood, be combined with your cancer cells, and even kill cells or ward off disease.
transcript: 可以在你的血液内循环，呃可以和你的癌症细胞结合，甚至它可以杀死，可以预警任何疾病。

translation: What does that mean?
transcript: 那么意味着什么？

translation: It means that in the future, in our blood, in addition to our normal human biological cells, there will be nanocells of different functions that can alert, diagnose, and even kill all kinds of bad cells.
transcript: 意味着未来我们的血液里流淌着除了我们正常的人类的生物的细胞之外，还会有什么，还会有各种各样不同功能的，预警的，啊这个诊断的，呃甚至杀死各种各样的坏细胞的这样的纳米级的啊纳米细胞。

translation: This is not science fiction; this is what is happening now.
transcript: 呃所以我想这也是正在发生的现实，这并不是科幻。

translation: Let's take a look at cells.
transcript: 那么我们看一下细胞。

translation: The most important cells are our embryonic stem cells.
transcript: 那当然啦，细胞最核心的呃最重要的细胞是我们的胚胎干细胞。

translation: Embryonic stem cells are primitive cells that can be transformed into functional cells in all parts of our body.
transcript: 因为大家都知道，胚胎干细胞是呃能够啊转化成我们人体的所有的各个部位的功能的细胞的原始的细胞。

translation: So what can embryonic stem cells do now?
transcript: 那么胚胎干细胞现在能干什么呢？

translation: This is what Austrian biogeneticists did in the laboratory in 2013.
transcript: 啊，这是2013年奥地利的这个生物遗传学家在实验室里做的事情。

translation: Can you tell what this is?
transcript: 呃能看出来这是什么吗？

translation: What is it?
transcript: 能看出来吗？

translation: Who can tell?
transcript: 谁能看出来？

translation: I will give this book to whoever gets it.
transcript: 我把书送给他。

translation: What?
transcript: 什么？

translation: An infant?
transcript: 婴儿？

translation: No.
transcript: 错！

translation: It's not that cruel; it's the human brain of a person who is dying.
transcript: 没那么残忍啊，它是一个人类的大脑，啊，他是一个濒临死亡的一个人类啊。

translation: In order to save him, they cultivated a new brain in their laboratory with his stem cells.
transcript: 那么为了拯救他，通过他的呃干细胞啊，那么然后啊给他在他的实验室里啊，培养了这么一个新的大脑。

translation: Now the technology has grown to the point where you don't need your embryonic stem cells to do something like this, as you only need one of your somatic cells.
transcript: 那么当然啦，现在科技已经发展到什么程度，不需要你的胚胎干细胞，只需要你的一个体细胞就可以做类似的事情。

translation: You have to know just how well developed the technology is now.
transcript: 啊所以你要知道现在科技已经发展到什么程度。

translation: That is, in the future, we can take any type of biological cells, synthesize them into a liquid in the laboratory, and then put them into a 3D printer and make any shape we want to eat.
transcript: 呃那就是未来我们只要取任何一个生物的体细胞，我们在实验室里都能合成成这样的液体，然后我们把它灌到3D打印机里，我们就可以啊打成我们任何想吃的形状 。

translation: There is another very cool thing that is happening.
transcript: 我觉得这个还是很酷的一件事情啊，这件事情正在发生啊。

translation: There is a firm called Green Farm in America.
transcript: 就在美国啊，这家公司，呃这个叫做绿色牧场。

translation: The company now also makes artificial leather through somatic cell technology.
transcript: 那么同样是这家公司，现在通过啊细胞技术，啊通过体细胞技术现在也能做呃人造的皮革。

translation: This leather is exactly the same as real leather, with pores in it.
transcript: 啊这个皮革其实和真的皮革是一模一样的，啊上面有也会有毛孔。

translation: But what advantages does it have?
transcript: 但是这样的技术好处在哪儿呢？

translation: If I want to make a bag, I have to kill a cow, a pig, or a seal, but with this technology I don’t need to kill at all, I just need somatic cells for synthesis.
transcript: 今天我要做一个包，今天我要杀一头牛，杀一头猪，杀一头海豹，但今天我需要不需要杀它了，我只要取一个体细胞我做合成。

translation: And after two weeks, what will happen?
transcript: 呃最后你会发现两个星期之后，最关键的是知道是什么吗？

translation: I will directly grow them into a bag instead of a piece of leather.
transcript: 我不是说长出来是一块皮，我直接长出来就是一个包。

translation: See?
transcript: 明白我的意思吗？

translation: This is the future; this is what is happening.
transcript: 啊所以我想这就是未来啊，这就是正在发生的现实。

translation: Let's take a look at genes.
transcript: 我们再看看基因。

translation: Genes are no stranger to us, and now many screenings for babies rely on them.
transcript: 啊基因我想对各位来说并不陌生啊，现在很多婴儿的这个筛查，啊大量的采采用这个基因的技术。

translation: In fact, nowadays, both gene replacement technology and gene repair technology are very popular in developed countries.
transcript: 那实际上基因现在无论是基因的替换技术和基因的修复技术，我想在呃世界发达国家现在都是广为流行的一件事情。

translation: If you can find out what kind of pathogenic genes your baby has in advance, you can use gene repair technology to make him into a normal child.
transcript: 那么我想这个我们的一个婴儿，如果早期能发现他带有什么样的致病的基因的话，你用基因的修复呃基因的修补的技术，其实都可以重新让他变成一个正常的孩子。

translation: Does anyone know this person?
transcript: 那么这位有人认识他吗？

translation: I'm going to have a hard time giving away my book.
transcript: 哎呀，我这个书很难送出去啊！

translation: This is a famous researcher at the University of Washington.
transcript: 我想这是华盛顿大学的啊一位著名的一位研究员啊。

translation: He studied cancer genomics, but unfortunately he got acute leukemia some time ago.
transcript: 他本身他自己就是研究癌症基因组学的，呃但是很不幸啊前段时间他自己得了急性的呃白血病。

translation: He was very talented.
transcript: 那么这个人很厉害。

translation: He didn’t think he deserved to die.
transcript: 这个人他认为自己不应该死。

translation: He said, “I am a cancer researcher. How can I die of cancer?”
transcript: 他说我是研究癌症的，我怎么能得癌症死呢？

translation: So he used himself as a test sample and repaired himself in the lab.
transcript: 所以啊他把自己当成试验品，啊在实验室里对他自己进行了基因修复。

translation: And then?
transcript: 结果呢？

translation: He survived.
transcript: ok了，他现在活了 。

translation: This is what is happening.
transcript: 啊所以我想这也是正在发生的现实啊。

translation: You can go to Washington University to visit him if you are interested.
transcript: 你们有兴趣可以去华盛单大大学去找他，啊。

translation: Finally we have the inflection point of 2046, the so-called AI, artificial intelligence.
transcript: 那么最后我想就是现在所说的2046的拐点，啊所谓的AI，所谓的人工智能。

translation: What will AI be like by 2046?
transcript: 那人工智能我想其实啊到了2046年，人工智能会发展到什么程度呢？

translation: If you have seen Machine Era starring Banderas, you will know that in 2046, 30 years later, humans will do nothing.
transcript: 呃其实我想你们如果看过前段时间这个班德拉斯主演的《机器纪元》就已经知道了，呃在未来的人类，在2046年的三十年以后的地球，我们人类呃再也什么都不用干了。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because everything will be done by robots.
transcript: 因为所有的事情都是机器人来做的。

translation: Of course, there will be a group of human policemen who will patrol day and night and supervise these robots.
transcript: 那么当然了会有一批人类的警察，他会日夜地巡查，他会监督这些啊机器人。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because robots are, to a certain extent, very dangerous once they become self-healing, self-repairing, self-coordinating, and generate their own consciousness.
transcript: 因为机器人某种程度上讲，一旦能够自我修复、自我修补、自我协同并且产生自己的意识的话，这件事情就非常危险。

translation: Why?
transcript: 知道为什么吗？

translation: Imagine what would happen if they held a Robotic Congress one day?
transcript: 因为假设你们想想看，有一天地球上机器人开机器人代表大会会怎么样？

translation: A robot says, "We have figured out that human beings are useless! Everything is done by us, right? Why should we listen to them, and why should they live off of us? Shall we vote to kill them?
transcript: 机器人说：“我们想了半天好像这个人类没什么用嘛！什么事都是我们干的，对不对？凭什么听他们的，凭什么养活他们呢？所以我们现在投票要不要把他们灭了。”

translation: There will be a 50% chance that we will be killed.
transcript: 所以我想会有50%的几率可能会把我们灭了，知道吧？

translation: Therefore, there will be a group of human policemen in the future who will supervise the robots day and night.
transcript: 所以未来会有一批人类的警察，会日夜地去看管这批机器人。

translation: But is this really feasible?
transcript: 啊那但是我想是不是真的能看得住呢？

translation: As a result, famous scientists like Hawking are now increasingly worried about what will happen when artificial intelligence gains self-awareness.
transcript: 所以像霍金这些这个大牌的科学家，现在就比较担心人工智能一旦真的，啊机器的智能，机器人的智商产生了自我智能，啊产生了自我智慧那会怎么样？

translation: Will it destroy the earth and humans?
transcript: 会不会毁灭地球，毁灭人类？

translation: Artificial intelligence has developed to a certain extent.
transcript: 呃但是我们撇开这件事情啊不谈，其实人工智能发展到一定程度。

translation: Do you know what its best advantage is?
transcript: 最大的好处知道是什么吗？

translation: There are many diseases that we cannot diagnose, nor overcome.
transcript: 就是你会发现这个地球上其实有很多疾病，我们没有办法自我诊断，是吧，到今天我们很多疾病没有办法攻克。

translation: What if robots created by us finally surpass us?
transcript: 但是实际上你想想看，我们如果由我们人类造出来的机器人最后它的智商超越了我们会怎么样？

translation: Maybe they could help us diagnose these diseases.
transcript: 也许它们有办法帮我们诊断。

translation: So what is this?
transcript: 这就是什么？

translation: We're talking about god.
transcript: 这就是上帝。

translation: For the first time, we humans are playing the role of the Creator.
transcript: 啊所以我们人类就第一次扮演了上帝的造物主的角色。

translation: Artificial intelligence is a very valuable and very important thing.
transcript: 所以人工智能是非常非常有价值，非常非常重要的一件事情。

translation: Today, there are many famous scientists in Europe, America and Japan, and they have already performed these robot simulations for themselves.
transcript: 今天在欧美在日本有很多大牌的科学家，已经提前为自己在做这样的仿真的机器人啊。

translation: These robots are quite cool and can represent them in a variety of situations.
transcript: 这样的机器人啊相当的酷，可以代表他们啊出席各种各样的场合啊。

translation: This is what is happening; this is not science fiction.
transcript: 我想这已经正在发生的事情啊，这并非科幻。

translation: Which doctor can best perform cancer diagnoses in the United States today?
transcript: 所以我想今天我们在美国可以看到全美现在最牛的癌症诊断的医生是什么？

translation: It's not a human, as it is a robot, instead: IBM's WATSON.
transcript: 不是人类，是机器人，是IBM的WATSON机器人。

translation: In the most famous cancer clinic of America, 85% of final diagnoses are made by WATSON, Dr. Watson.
transcript: 那我想，今天啊在全美最有名的，啊这个癌症诊疗中心，啊那么有85%的最终的诊断啊是由这个WATSON机器人，啊或者说我们叫做华生医生，由它来做出的判断。

translation: This is what is happening.
transcript: 啊我想这已经正在发生的事实。

translation: You have seen this movie and you all like Baymax a lot.
transcript: 那么所以啊你们看过这部电影，都对大白很有感觉，啊。

translation: If you want our opinion, the current Baymax is still very stupid.
transcript: 那么当然了现在的大白在我们看来还是非常的愚蠢的啊。

translation: It has to ask you several questions in order to diagnose you depending on your answers.
transcript: 它要诊断你有没有问题，它甚至还要给你问出一二三个问题，它要Q你，然后你A了之后它才有答案。

translation: But in fact, you don’t need questions at all.
transcript: 但实际上未来根本就不需要Q啊。

translation: Eventually there will be all kinds of sensors implanted in our bodies.
transcript: 因为很简单，因为未来我们的人体啊会植入各种各样的传感器。

translation: The future Baymax, our health assistant, doesn’t need to ask questions.
transcript: 所以未来的大白，未来的我们的啊这个机器人的这个健康助理，它并不需要问我们问题。

translation: It can determine our problems with sensors.
transcript: 它通过传感器就已经能够感知我们会有什么样的问题。

translation: This is what will happen in the future.
transcript: 所以我想这就是啊未来我们会发生的事情。

translation: Of course, in addition to the six technologies we just mentioned, 3D printing, cloning, nano technology, cell technology, genetics and artificial intelligence, there is a more thorough solution: the "Avatar Plan.”
transcript: 当然啦，呃除了刚才我们说了3D打印、呃克隆、纳米、细胞、基因及人工智能，呃这六大技术之外，啊还有一种更彻底的啊解决方案啊，那其实就是“阿凡达计划”啊。

translation: In addition to the Pentagon’s Avatar plan, there is actually a more famous plan which has been studied very thoroughly.
transcript: 当然我想阿凡达计划除了美国五角大楼有一个阿凡达的计划之外呢，其实更有名的啊或者说我们研究得更深的啊。

translation: It is what a 2045 lab led by the Russian billionaire Izkov is doing.
transcript: 那是呃在俄罗斯啊一个富豪啊伊茨科夫现在正在领导的一个2045实验室在做的事情。

translation: We have seen the movie Avatar.
transcript: 那么实际上大家都看过这个《阿凡达》这部电影。

translation: From the movie, you can understand what kind of situation we are going to be living in.
transcript: 我想其实你们可以理解未来的人类会生存在一个什么样的情况下。

translation: We are going to live in a revolutionarily new way.
transcript: 未来的人类的生存方式会发生重大的颠覆啊。

translation: We are going to live in a virtual space that seems so real.
transcript: 未来我们会生活在一个虚拟的空间，但是又如此的真实。

translation: That is the future.
transcript: 啊我想这就是未来。

translation: The leader of the 2045 Lab is the Russian billionaire Izkov.
transcript: 那么这位就是2045实验室的这个领领袖啊，这个俄罗斯的富豪伊茨科夫。

translation: There are 5000 top scientists in the world who want to work for him.
transcript: 啊现在啊全球已经有五千名顶级的科学家，现在希望为他工作。

translation: Donations from countless rich guys around the world make it to him.
transcript: 啊那么全球无数的富豪现在捐款给他，资助这件事。

translation: Do you know why?
transcript: 知道为什么吗？

translation: It is because rich people are afraid of death.
transcript: 因为有钱人都怕死，知道吗？

translation: Of course, poor people are also afraid.
transcript: 啊这非常重要，当然没钱的人也怕死啊。

translation: It is already very clear what he must do every five or ten years from 2015 to 2045.
transcript: 所以我想在他的这个计划里面，其实已经非常清楚的啊从2015年到2045年这三十年，啊每隔五年十年他究竟要做什么，已经非常清楚了。

translation: Five years from now, something is going to happen.
transcript: 那么从今年开始再过五年，啊就会发生一件事情。

translation: What is it?
transcript: 这件事情是什么？

translation: A human in his lab will be able to control a robot a thousand kilometers away using just his natural brain consciousness.
transcript: 就是在他的实验室里一个人类，呃通过他自然的大脑的呃意识就可以控制一个千里之外的robot机器人，啊。

translation: What will happen after five years starting from 2020?
transcript: 那我想接着从2020年呃接着再走，再走五年，啊会发生一个什么事情呢？

translation: Quite simply, when a natural human life comes to an end, the brain tissue of the deceased can be transplanted to a robot.
transcript: 很简单，啊当一个人类啊，自然的生命走到终结之后，他的大脑的组织可以移植到一个机器人身上。

translation: Of course, such a brain should be maintained in its proper environment with the right nutrients and, of course, water.
transcript: 啊当然要给这个大脑的组织啊维持它适当的环境和养分，啊当然还有水分等等。

translation: This is the combination of man and machine.
transcript: 那么这是什么，这就是人机合一，啊。

translation: What will happen after five years starting from 2030?
transcript: 那么接下来，啊，2030年呃接着往后走再走五年会发生什么样的事情？

translation: A very important thing will happen.
transcript: 你就会发现，啊一个非常重要的事实会发生了。

translation: When a person dies, all of his brain consciousness, experiences, emotions, memories, etc. will be digitized, and then transferred.
transcript: 就是当这个人死亡之后，其实这个人的所有的大脑的意识、经验、情感、记忆等等所有东西将会被数字化，然后会被转移。

translation: But where will they go?
transcript: 啊传到哪儿？

translation: Maybe they will be transmitted to a USB drive, or perhaps to an external hard drive; of course, we will eventually pass this data on to the cloud, a so-called brain cloud, or the cloud cortex of our brain.
transcript: 也许传到一个U盘上，也许传到一个移动硬盘上，当然最终我们是会传到一个云端，所谓的啊brain cloud，我们的大脑云皮层。

translation: Then, when this happens, it means that the entire consciousness of this person has been transferred to a machine, and this machine will survive forever as long as you provide it with enough energy.
transcript: 那么当这样的事情发生之后，啊意味着什么，呃意味着人所有的意识其实都已经转移到一个机器的身上，那么这个机器只要你维持它足够的能量，那么这个人将永续地生存。

translation: Of course, this is not the ultimate goal.
transcript: 当然这不是最终的目标。

translation: The ultimate goal is that by 2045, the most exciting revolution will occur.
transcript: 最终的目标是到了2045年，人类最激动人心的重大的颠覆就出现了。

translation: Do you know what that is?
transcript: 知道是什么吗？

translation: That is, in the end, every human being will exist in the form of a three-dimensional hologram.
transcript: 就是我们，啊我们人类最终啊每一个个体会以什么样的形式存在，我们是以三维全息的形式存在的，明白吗？

translation: If humans can exist in a three-dimensional holographic way, is there still value for our current existence?
transcript: 你想想看如果我们人类是以三维全息的方式存在的，我们人类的现在的生存方式还有价值吗？

translation: Will we need food?
transcript: 我们还要吃饭吗？

translation: Will we need sleep?
transcript: 我们要睡觉吗？

translation: Will we need water?
transcript: 我们还要喝水吗？

translation: We will be able to walk through walls and move forward at the speed of light.
transcript: 我们可以穿墙走壁，是吧，我们可以光速前进。

translation: So it is thus not difficult for you to understand why Hawking appeared in the Grand Theatre in Sydney some time ago, while he was actually in Cambridge.
transcript: 所以你们也就不难理解为什么霍金前段时间可以出现在悉尼的大剧院，其实他的人本身是在剑桥大学。

translation: Of course, he was projected into the Sydney Grand Theatre in the form of a three-dimensional hologram.
transcript: 呃那当然是以三维全息的形式投射到悉尼大剧院。

translation: He gave a very wonderful speech and there was a very lively interaction.
transcript: 现场做了一场非常精彩的演讲，还和现场做了一个非常热烈的互动。

translation: I think, in the future, of course, if Hawking can catch up, if he can hold on, maybe he will exist in this world in the form of a three-dimensional hologram forever.
transcript: 呃那我想未来其实霍金，呃当然他如果能够赶上，能够撑得住啊，也许他就会永远以三维全息的形式存在于这个世界。

translation: Once human beings become 3D holograms, and once we can live forever, you will see that the earth is a very boring place, and you will find that the phrase that matters is not, "the world is so big, I want to see it,” but rather, "the universe is very big, I want to see it.”
transcript: 那么我想未来我们的人类，当我们的人类一旦实现我们都变成三维全息，一旦我们的人类实现可以永生，永远不死，你会发现地球上非常无聊，你就会发现不是“世界那么大，我想去看看”了，那是“宇宙很大，我想去看看。”

translation: NASA has been studying for 46 years, and it has now finally made a breakthrough.
transcript: 那么我想NASA美国的航空航天局已经用了46年的时间，现在终于取得了突破。

translation: They finally discovered that near the surface of the earth there was a time and space vortex.
transcript: 他们终于发现地球的表面，啊附近的位置出现了什么，出现了时空的漩涡。

translation: Do you understand what a “time and space vortex” is?
transcript: 听得懂什么叫“时空的漩涡”吗？

translation: Who can explain this?
transcript: 有谁能说说？

translation: A time and space vortex is very simple.
transcript: 时空的漩涡非常简单。

translation: It is a wormhole.
transcript: 就是传说中的虫洞，知道吧？

translation: So what if we found a wormhole?
transcript: 那么意味着如果当我们找到了虫洞会怎么样？

translation: We could reach Mars and Saturn in an instant.
transcript: 我们可以瞬间到达火星，瞬间到达土星。

translation: You might say, "Mars is so hot, and Saturn is so cold, how could we survive?”
transcript: 你说：“火星那么热，土星那么冷，我们怎么活？”

translation: But when we are three-dimensional holograms, we will not be afraid of heat or cold.
transcript: 我们是三维全息，我们不怕热我们也不怕冷。

translation: You see?
transcript: 明白我的意思吧？

translation: So at that time you will find that human beings have the greatest amount of freedom, and our human civilization will have reached its highest level.
transcript: 所以那个时候你会发现，人类得到了最大的解放，我们人类的文明达到了一个最高的境界。

translation: Finally, everyone, let's hold out for 2046.
transcript: 所以最后一句话，各位，一定要撑到2046。

translation: Let’s witness the arrival of the most incredible and exciting moment in the history of human civilization.
transcript: 让我们共同来见证人类文明史上最不可思议，最激动人心的时刻的到来。

translation: Thank you.
transcript: 谢谢。
